page.title: 19LOCAL HISTORY CONTINUED
page.content:
Delamere/Eddisbury
{LOCAL HISTORY CONTINUED Eddisbury was also occupied in Roman times. It made a good vantage point between Chester & Northwich.(There is a photograph of it). The forest itself was a Royal hunting forest & the Normans called it forest of the lakes. The first Norman Earl of Chester,Hugh Lupus(Hugh the Wolf) was granted rights to hunt in it by William the Conqueror. On Eddisbury there was a Royal hunting lodge which became known as the Chamber in the Forest.It became delapidated in the 1800's although evidence of its existence can still be seen today. In 1812 the forest was deemed 'a place for growing trees'& planting began in 1816. Prior to this forests had been places for hunting.
